label: 役小角
本: Early Japanese History c. 40 B.C.-A.D. 1167,  Part B . Princeton University Press . 1937
説明文: d. circa 715. He was a Buddhist mystic with much of the Taoist priest about him.  He lived in the mountains, climbing difficult peaks and dedicating them to the worship of the Buddhas.  He was accused of sorcery, and of leading the people astray, [and was] exiled to an island in Izu-no-kuni (Part A, p. 163). [伊豆国]
